message.content:
cs.DB, cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the chase procedure, which is a well-known algorithm in the database community for fixing constraint violations in database instances. Therefore, cs.DB (Databases) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses termination conditions, which involve logical reasoning and constraints, making cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) another likely sub-category. The paper proposes a novel sufficient termination condition that can be checked efficiently, which involves algorithmic techniques and artificial intelligence, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category. The paper also studies the problem of data-dependent chase termination, which involves data structures and algorithms, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper presents sufficient termination conditions w.r.t. fixed instances, which involve computational complexity and complexity theory, making cs.CC (Computational Complexity) a possible sub-category.
